item.title: Heather add a quote by Beth Gutcheon
item.description: "I wanted this day, the perfect buttery sun like peach ice cream, the speed, the satin leather of the car seat, the fair. Forbidden fruit, a day like no other. " -- Beth Gutcheon

item.title: Heather add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Someone had cleared that hillside once to make an orchard that had fallen into ruin and was now only twisted silver branches and split trunks. I sat there and continued to watch the sky as, out of nowhere, great solid-looking clouds built hot stacks and cotton cones. I was sixteen years old." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Heather add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Ever morning, until you dead in the ground, you gone have to make this decision. You gone have to ask yourself, "Am I gone believe what them fools say about me today?" -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "In the end we had the pieces of the puzzle, but no matter how we put them together, gaps remained, oddly shaped emptinesses mapped by what surrounded them, like countries we couldn't name." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Heather add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Maybe some love was guaranteed. Maybe it fit inside you and around you like skin and bones." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Heather add a quote by Hannah Pittard
item.description: "We were growing up. It was one of those moments when you could practically feel the adult pushing out, pushing forward into the world. Perspective suddenly existed where it hadn't existed before. This was just the beginning of our lives—our lives, things that we were responsible for, things that we could control. It seemed all at once too big and too simple an idea." -- Hannah Pittard

item.title: Heather add a quote by Alison Espach
item.description: "The neighborhood had gotten really into pastel the last few years. It started when Alfred's wife painted their whole house a soft pink during menopause. Looks Like Linen it was called. People raved. A magazine came, made the family hold up a rotisserie chicken, and then photographed it. A few months later, Mrs. Trenton's house was Mint Leaf. Ours became Celery Powder. The Resnicks' house turned Yellow Feather." -- Alison Espach

item.title: Heather add a quote by Jennifer Miller
item.description: "The moment you killed something – a living creature or a false hope – was the moment you came of age. Loss of innocence wasn’t a passive experience that happened <i>to</i> you. It was something you gave up." -- Jennifer Miller

item.title: Heather add a quote by Erin Morgenstern
item.description: "Everything I have done, every change I have made to that circus, every impossible feat and astounding sight, I have done for her." -- Erin Morgenstern
